contentList.content: <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYZED">Stronger Bosses</LSTag>: When this entity fall down to 0 HP, it stays at 1 HP and is <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVULNERABLE">invulnerable</LSTag> for the rest of its turn.
The next time damage would reduce the affected entity to 0 <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag>, it remains conscious with [2] hit point left.

This entity is immune to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYZED">Paralysing</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STUNNED">Stun</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISON_CRAWLER_MUCUS_CONDITION">Incapacitate</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DOMINATE_PERSON">Charm</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POLYMORPH_SHEEP">Polymorph</LSTag>.

Affected entity can't move or take actions, bonus actions, or reactions.

Attacks against the entity are always Critical Hits if the attacker is within [1].

Your reflexes are enhanced by the light weight of your equipment. If you are not wearing Medium or Heavy Armour and have nothing equipped in your Off-Hand, you gain a +2 bonus to your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag>.
This entity is guarded against Death. If an attack would drop it below [1] HP, this entity stays invulnerable with [2] HP for [3] turns insteed.
This entity is stronger, in a way or another.
This entity is immune to all damage type, all kind of Crowd Control and cannot be moved against its will.
Protect a creature from death. The next time damage would reduce it to 0 <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag>, it remains conscious with 1 hit point left.
Increase <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag> of nerby Giths by [1], and give theim <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SEE_INVISIBILITY">True Sight</LSTag>.
<LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag> increased by [1], as long as the affected entity stays within [2] of the Gishra.
This entity is either under divine protection or is an avatar of a deity. Interfering with such a being would be unwise.
This entity is leading the pack and gets +[1] increased <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>. It also <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLESS">reinvigorates</LSTag> nearby allies.
The fetid stench of the mauled sheep enrages the nearby worgs, granting theim increased ferocity and an insatiable bloodlust. Worgs within [1] of the sheep are empowered.
Enraged. Gain double movement speed and deal an additionnal [1] when attacking.
Enraged. Gain double movement speed and deal an additionnal [1] when attacking.
This entity has increased <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLESS">Reinvigorates</LSTag> nearby allies.

Auril, the Queen of Frozen Tears, personifies the merciless chill of winter and its most lethal aspects. Her icy beauty, as cold as her heart, is eternally preserved beneath a veil of frost, embodying the cruel and unrelenting force of the frozen season.
Myrkul, also known as the Lord of Bones, is the God of Death and a member of the Dead Three. He is associated with the domain of Death.
As the greater deity of darkness, Shar is feared for her power over the night, secrets, and loss. She is locked in eternal conflict with her twin sister Selûne, goddess of the moon.
The Lady of Silver presides over the moon, stars, and navigation. Her power over the heavens is constantly challenged by her sister Shar, who seeks to plunge the world into eternal shadow.
Zehir, the god of poison and shadows, is a cunning interloper who carved his domain in a realm of toxic mists and perpetual night. His venomous will seeps into Toril, spreading corruption and death.

Cyric, the Prince of Lies, is the god of strife, trickery, and illusion. Once a tyrant who sought to unravel the divine order, his murder of Mystra and alliance with Shar plunged the cosmos into chaos during the Spellplague. His shadow lingers still, drawing mortals into discord and deceit, promising power but delivering only ruin.
Maglubiyet, known as The Mighty One, is the chief deity of goblins and hobgoblins. In the myths of the Forgotten Realms, he is considered an exarch of Bane, the god of tyranny.
Maglubiyet, known as The Mighty One, is the chief deity of goblins and hobgoblins.
Maglubiyet, known as The Mighty One, is the chief deity of goblins and hobgoblins.
This mind flayer has recently died; it still radiates dangerous psionic energies.
You feel exceptionally good, yet something feels amiss...
Loviatar, known as the Maiden of Pain, is the goddess of agony, embodying the mastery of both physical and psychological suffering; her domain encompasses hurt and torture.
Loviatar, known as the Maiden of Pain, is the goddess of agony, embodying the mastery of both physical and psychological suffering; her domain encompasses hurt and torture.
Loviatar, known as the Maiden of Pain, is the goddess of agony, embodying the mastery of both physical and psychological suffering; her domain encompasses hurt and torture.
Auril is the goddess of cold and winter, a Neutral Evil deity who urges her clerics to raise ice and freeze all in their path. She grants spells that unleash devastating storms of frost and ice.

Cyric is the god of lies and strife, a Chaotic Evil deity who urges his clerics to sow discord and manipulate the weak. He grants spells that deceive, confound, and twist the minds of those who oppose them.

Zehir is the god of poison and shadows, a Chaotic Evil deity who commands his clerics to spread venom and sow chaos. He grants spells that envenom weapons and summon deadly serpents to strike from the dark.
Maglubiyet, known as The Mighty One, is the chief deity of goblins and hobgoblins. In the myths of the Forgotten Realms, he is considered an exarch of Bane, the god of tyranny.
Loviatar, known as the Maiden of Pain, is the goddess of agony, embodying the mastery of both physical and psychological suffering; her domain encompasses hurt and torture.

Bhaal is the notorious god of murder, reborn after each of his descendants were viciously slain. He has a tenuous alliance with Myrkul and Bane, the three having attained divinity in a bargain with Jergal.
Myrkul, also known as the Lord of Bones, is the God of Death and a member of the Dead Three. He is associated with the domain of Death.

Auril, the Queen of Frozen Tears, personifies the merciless chill of winter and its most lethal aspects. Her icy beauty, as cold as her heart, is eternally preserved beneath a veil of frost, embodying the cruel and unrelenting force of the frozen season.
Zehir, the god of poison and shadows, is a cunning interloper who carved his domain in a realm of toxic mists and perpetual night. His venomous will seeps into Toril, spreading corruption and death.

Cyric, the Prince of Lies, is the god of strife, trickery, and illusion. Once a tyrant who sought to unravel the divine order, his murder of Mystra and alliance with Shar plunged the cosmos into chaos during the Spellplague. His shadow lingers still, drawing mortals into discord and deceit, promising power but delivering only ruin.
Auril is the goddess of cold and winter, a Neutral Evil deity who urges her clerics to raise ice and freeze all in their path. She grants spells that unleash devastating storms of frost and ice.
Myrkul is the god of death and decay. He has few clerics, but those who serve his faith inspire a fear of death in others, bringing doom wherever they tread.
This entity is under the protection of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CCSTATUS_LOVIATAR">Loviatar</LSTag>.
This entity is under the protection of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CCSTATUS_MAGLUBIYET">Maglubiyet</LSTag>.
This entity is under the protection of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CCSTATUS_SHAR">Shar</LSTag>.
Bane, The Black Hand, is the god of tyrannical oppression, terror, and hate, known across Faerûn as the face of pure evil through malevolent despotism.
Jergal was the Lord of the End of Everything, Faerûn's original god of death before he eventually ceded his position.
Jergal was the Lord of the End of Everything, Faerûn's original god of death before he eventually ceded his position.
This entity is under the protection of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CCSTATUS_AURIL">Auril</LSTag>.
This entity is under the protection of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CCSTATUS_MYRKUL">Myrkul</LSTag>.
This entity is under the protection of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CCSTATUS_SELUNE">Selûne</LSTag>.
This entity is under the protection of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CCSTATUS_ZEHIR">Zehir</LSTag>.
This entity is under the protection of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CCSTATUS_CYRIC">Cyric</LSTag>.
This entity is under the protection of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CCSTATUS_BANE">Bane</LSTag>.
This entity is under the protection of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CCSTATUS_JERGAL">Jergal</LSTag>.
Jergal, the Lord of the End of Everything, was Faerûn's original god of death before he eventually ceded his position.
Jergal, the Lord of the End of Everything, was Faerûn's original god of death before he eventually ceded his position.

<LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="NightmareMode_StrongerBosses">Stronger Bosses</LSTag>: This entity is immune to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYZED">Paralysing</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STUNNED">Stun</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISON_CRAWLER_MUCUS_CONDITION">Incapacitate</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DOMINATE_PERSON">Charm</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POLYMORPH_SHEEP">Polymorph</LSTag>.
This entity can see invisible units. <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Hide">Sneaking</LSTag> rules still applies.

This entity is leading the pack and gets +[1] increased <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>. He can also <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_CommandersStrike_StrongerChief">Command</LSTag> nearby subjects.
This character is issuing commands to nearby allies, directing their actions and influencing their behavior.
A nearby commander is issuing orders to this entity, directing its actions and influencing its behavior.
This entity is galvanized by the presence of the of a nearby <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="NightmareMode_StrongerChief">Little Chief</LSTag>.
This entity is galvanized by the presence of the of a nearby <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="NightmareMode_StrongerChief">Little Chief</LSTag>.
« The Absolute is gold from the sky, She is. The blessin' in the storm an' the storm itself.»
The Absolute is shrouded in mystery, but it generally assumed to be a deity, with many professing themselves acolytes and clerics of it.
The Absolute is shrouded in mystery, but it is generally assumed to be a deity, with many professing themselves as its acolytes and clerics.
The Absolute is shrouded in mystery, but it is generally assumed to be a deity, with many professing themselves as its acolytes and clerics.
This entity is under the protection of the <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CCSTATUS_THEABSOLUTE">Absolute</LSTag>.
Stronger Bosses also get +[1] to their <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>.
